metadata.title: CVE-2020-12387 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A race condition when running shutdown code for Web Worker led to a use-after-free vulnerability. This resulted in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
